synopsis.p: reads documents and annotations from an AlvisAE campaign.

description.p: reads an AlvisAE server database and imports documents and annotation sets from an annotation campaign. The database connection is specified with url, username, password and schema. The campaignId parameter specifies the campaign identifier in the AlvisAE database (the AlvisAE client displays this identifier).

All AlvisAE annotations, including text-bound annotations, will be represented in AlvisNLP as relation tuples, in a relation named after the annotation type.
For text-bound annotations, each fragment is represented in an annotation stored in the layer fragmentsLayer. The tuple references the fragments through its arguments; their role name is fragmentRolePrefix with the fragment order appended (starting at zero). Thus a single-fragment annotation will have a single argument with role frag0. The type of the annotation is stored in the feature typeFeature of the tuple and of each fragment.
A group tuple references its items through its arguments; their role name is itemRolePrefix with the item order appended (starting at zero).
A relation tuple hareferences its arguments in a straightforward way.

param-doc.name: docExternalIds
param-doc.p: If set, imports only documents whose external id is included in the value. If not set, then imports all documents.

param-doc.name: typeFeature
param-doc.p: Feature that contains the type of the annotation.

param-doc.name: password
param-doc.p: User password for JDBC connection.

param-doc.name: campaignId
param-doc.p: Identifiers of the AlvisAE campaigns to import.

param-doc.name: campaignIdFeature
param-doc.p: Name of the document feature where to store the campaign id.

param-doc.name: campaignNameFeature
param-doc.p: Name of the document feature where to store the campaign name.

param-doc.name: userFeature
param-doc.p: Name of the feature where to store the name of the AlvisAE user that created the annotation.

param-doc.name: userNames
param-doc.p: If set, imports only annotation sets created by an user included in the value. If this parameter and userIds are not set, imports annotations of all users.

param-doc.name: loadTextBound
param-doc.p: Either to import text-bound annotations.

param-doc.name: taskName
param-doc.p: If set, imports only annotation sets of tasks whose name is included in the value. If this parameter and taskId are not set, imports annotations of all tasks.

param-doc.name: itemRolePrefix
param-doc.p: Prefix of the roles of arguments that represent group items.

param-doc.name: taskFeature
param-doc.p: Name of the feature where to store the name task where the annotation belongs.

param-doc.name: docIds
param-doc.p: If set, imports only documents whose external id is included in the value. If not set, then imports all documents.

param-doc.name: username
param-doc.p: PostgreSQL user name.

param-doc.name: loadGroups
param-doc.p: Either to import group annotations.

param-doc.name: taskId
param-doc.p: If set, imports only annotation sets of tasks whose id is included in the value. If this parameter and taskName are not set, imports annotations of all tasks.

param-doc.name: userIds
param-doc.p: If set, imports only annotation sets created by an user whose id is included in the value. If this parameter and userNames are not set, imports annotations of all users.

param-doc.name: schema
param-doc.p: PostgreSQL schema.

param-doc.name: fragmentRolePrefix
param-doc.p: For tuples that represent text-bound annotations, prefix of the role of fragment arguments.

param-doc.name: section
param-doc.p: Name of the unique section created in each document.

param-doc.name: sectionName
param-doc.p: Deprecated alias for section.

param-doc.name: docDescriptions
param-doc.p: If set, imports only documents whose description is included in the value. If not set, then imports all documents.

param-doc.name: fragmentTypeFeature
param-doc.p: In annotations that represent text-bound fragments, name of the feature where to store the type of the annotation.

param-doc.name: kindFeature
param-doc.p: Name of the relation feature containing the annotation kind (values are: text-bound, group, or relation).

param-doc.name: loadRelations
param-doc.p: Either to import relation annotations.

param-doc.name: head
param-doc.p: If true, then imports the head annotation set. If false, then imports the annotation set with version 1.

param-doc.name: url
param-doc.p: PostgreSQL database URL.

param-doc.name: fragmentsLayer
param-doc.p: Name of the layer where to store text-bound annotation fragments.

param-doc.name: fragmentsLayerName
param-doc.p: Deprecated alias for fragmentsLayer.

param-doc.name: descriptionFeature
param-doc.p: Feature containing the document description.

param-doc.name: externalIdFeature
param-doc.p: Feature containing the document external id.

param-doc.name: createdFeature
param-doc.p: Feature containing the annotation creation date.

param-doc.name: oldModel
param-doc.p: Support database model for AlvisAE v0.3.

param-doc.name: sourceRolePrefix
param-doc.p: Prefix for the roles for source annotations, will only be used if loadDependencies is true.

param-doc.name: loadDependencies
param-doc.p: Either to load dependencies if the annotation set task is a review.

param-doc.name: adjudicate
param-doc.p: Either to automatically adjudicate identical source annotations, implies loadDependencies.

param-doc.name: referentFeature
param-doc.p: Name of the feature where to store back-reference of sources.

param-doc.name: annotationIdFeature
param-doc.p: Name of the feature where to store AlvisAE identifier of the annotation.

param-doc.name: annotationSetIdFeature
param-doc.p: Name of the feature where to store the identifier of the annotation set to which belongs the annotation.

param-doc.name: taskIdFeature
param-doc.p: Feature where to store the task identifier from which the annotation was imported.

param-doc.name: userIdFeature
param-doc.p: Feature where to store the user identifier from which the annotation was imported.

param-doc.name: htmlTagFeature
param-doc.p: Feature where to store HTML tag name for annotations imported from the HTML annotation set.

param-doc.name: unmatchedFeature
param-doc.p: Feature where to store the AlvisAE identifiers of unmatched annotations (for review annotation sets).

param-doc.name: htmlLayer
param-doc.p: Name of the layer where to store annotations that represent HTML tags.

param-doc.name: htmlLayerName
param-doc.p: Deprecated alias for htmlLayer.
